snippet: Participants were shown images of women alongside scientific words and black men with pleasant words and heard sounds that were played back during a 90-minute nap.
abstract: Study in journal Science finds that it may be possible to reduce people's racial and gender biases through technique called counterstereotype training, carried out in part while subject is asleep.
lead_paragraph: Participants were shown images of women alongside scientific words and black men with pleasant words and heard sounds that were played back during a 90-minute nap.

headline.print_headline: Anthropology: Study Suggests Sleeping One’s Way Past Bias
headline.main: Race and Gender Biases Can be Reduced With Sleep Therapy, Study Finds
